projects.title: CEN member TC252, workgroup 5
projects.description:
CEN, the European Committee for Standardization is an international non-profit organization set. Through its services, it provides a platform for the development of European Standards (ENs) and other consensus documents. CEN's 33 National Members work together to develop these publications in a large number of sectors to help build the European internal market in goods and services, removing barriers to trade and strengthening Europe's position in the global economy. 
CEN works in a decentralized way. Its members – the National Standardization Bodies (NSBs) of the EU and EFTA countries – operate the technical groups that draw up the standards.
I am participating in the TC252, workgroup 5, Child use and care articles since 2007. Participating in discussions, decisions  and rewriting the international requirements for example the EN1400 [soothers] and  EN14350 [drinking equipment]. The annually meetings are putting these requirements under her microscope and adjust these to a clear safety restriction. If needed  to develop measuring gauges to avoid interpretation differences for test laboratories and developers.

projects.title: NEN member 330001 Children’s articles
projects.description:
CEN's National Members are the National Standards Bodies (NSBs) of the 27 European Union countries, Croatia, The Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, and Turkey plus three countries of the European Free Trade Association (Iceland, Norway and Switzerland). There is one member per country. In the Netherlands this is the NEN.
The standardization system in Europe is based on these national pillars. A National Standards Body is the one stop shop for all stakeholders and is the main focal point of access to the concerted system, which comprises regional (European) and international (ISO) standardization. It is the responsibility of the CEN National Members to implement European Standards as national standards, which is unique in the world. 
I am participating the 330001 [Children’s articles] since 2007. This workgroup determines the Dutch position on European standard texts of different topics such as cots, playpens or strollers. In the Dutch standard committee are represented various parties from industry, government and test houses. I am representing in this group my profession as a designer and the CEN member TC252, workgroup 5 to summarize their meetings and explain the discussed topics.

profile_positions.description:
Difrax is a supplier and designer of infant and toddler products such as soothers, feeding bottles, drinking cups and accessories. Expanding her sales and marketing efforts to other countries around the globe in Europe, USA and Asia.
I am responsible for the development of new products [e.g. BtoB electrical breastpump, juicebox holder deluxe, toddler bowl & plate]. New products with an innovative and premium-A character. 
In 2010 I became the manager of our product development department and responsible for the development output of our small team.
One of the main thoughts for this department is product safety. Infants and toddler do not think about safety, they even challenge the extremes of safety and therefore one of the markets provided with many regulations. 
I am also answerable for the communication with our suppliers during the development stages in Thailand, China and Taiwan. Subsequently I am responsible for the final mass production control here in the Netherlands but also annually on the diverse production plants. Therefore enhanced the communication so that the factory workers do understand the part and product requirements. I have studied their knowledge and production processes to get the required quality in quantity at long last. 
Coaching graduates, students or groups who elaborate projects for our company commissioned by their university. 
I am also involved with processes like patents, 510K and part of the team for ISO certification to amplify the professionalization of the organization. 

Awards: 
2016 Breastpump: MyChildExcellenceAward - Breastpumps - Silver [Australia]
2014 Bottle warmer: Red Dot Design Award; Honourable Mention - Product Design
2013 Breastpump: HKEIA Award 2013 Consumer Electronics; Gold Award Winner
2013 Breastpump: Baby Product Award 2013, Winner [Belgium]
2012 Breastpump: Red Dot Design Award; Winner - Product Design
2011 Breastpump: Baby Innovation Award, Winner [Netherlands]
profile_positions.title: Senior Product Designer

profile_positions.description:
Meccano is a company focused on the development of innovative non-food consumer products for the retailer and A-brand manufacturers. Established in 1990 in the Netherlands. The developed products are suitable for mass production and are targeted to the mass consumer. These products are manufactured according the specifications at the lowest cost from manufacturer [Europe and China] direct to the client. The market segments focus is mainly on houseware, appliances and specialty non-food consumer products.
When I joined Meccano in 2001 I became the first in-house product designer. A structured product development process was not something which was commonplace. My responsibility was during this initial start-up to elaborate all the internal and customers requested products and projects. The elaboration contains not only the development of industrial mass production articles but in some cases even a special packaging for these products. Product analysis, competitor analysis, patent analysis, production plant communication, design, production audits etc. are scales which evolved rapidly in many different markets, materials  and products. Project examples are a toothpaste dispenser,  a corkscrew, a toothpick including brush, lunchbox “Sandwich” and lunchbox “Gruitbox” .
In 2004 the team expanded with more designers. This results in a tight collaboration of this team and clear division of product parts during complex projects such as the PUC coffee machine. Also a clear process in the development becomes more essential for project take-over.

Awards:
Lunchbox “Gruitbox”: AGF Trend Award 2005
profile_positions.title: Industrial Designer

profile_positions.description:
Interall Group is market leader in producing creative and powerful promotional products. A company with more than 20 years experience in the promotional market. The head office was based in Naarden with O.E.M. factories in China, Dong Guang City and for some products in Naarden. The Wuppie is one of their best promotional products of the last decade. More than 55 million have been sold worldwide and it is still a unique promotional product. Countless numbers of models are available. 
I started as a graphic designer+ to make sure all the promotional items were provided with a  graphic design [e.g. AddClock and backer cards.] Main interpretation of this position was executive and the procedure and communicative center between customers, printers and production plant. The next stage was becoming more responsible for the development of new promotional items. Unfortunately economics  cut the available budgets for this development and my position became redundant.
profile_positions.title: Industrial Designer
